summary: This is an email chain from January 27, 2020, between individuals with a US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) email domain. The emails discuss confusion and inquiries from attorneys about a public event or announcement being held at Jeffrey Epstein's house that morning, which the prosecutors were unaware of. One email clarifies the event was a speech by an unnamed individual invited by Safe Horizons to commemorate a New York State law regarding civil suits for sexual abuse victims.

events.title: Event/Announcement at Epstein's House
events.description: An event or announcement was held at Jeffrey Epstein's house, prompting inquiries from attorneys involved in the case. Prosecutors were unaware of the event, causing embarrassment. It was later clarified as a speech by an unnamed individual invited by Safe Horizons to commemorate a New York State law allowing victims of sexual abuse to bring civil suits irrespective of statute of limitations.

keyFacts: On January 27, 2020, attorneys involved in the Epstein case began contacting prosecutors asking about a 'big announcement' happening at Epstein's house that morning.
The prosecutors (USANYS) had no prior knowledge of the event, describing the situation as 'extremely embarrassing'.

The event was later clarified as a speech by an unnamed individual invited by the victim services organization Safe Horizons to commemorate a New York State law regarding civil suits for sexual abuse victims.
The email chain shows internal coordination and confusion within the prosecution team regarding public events related to the case.
